comment.text: The translation key "Client" is used to display the label for a form field related to a client in an OAuth setup. It appears in a block component that allows users to manage OAuth settings and is likely displayed on a form or settings page for developers.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation "ນະຄູຝາກ" does not accurately convey the meaning of "Client" in the context of OAuth. "ນະຄູຝາກ" generally means "depositary" or "warehouse," which is unrelated to a client application.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation for "Client" in this context might be something like "ແອັບພິເຄຊັນຜູ້ໃຊ້" (application user) or "ໄคล້ອນท์" (transliteration of 'client'). The best option would depend on the wider context and the desired level of technical accuracy.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "පාරිභෝගිකයා" (paribhōgikayā) can mean 'consumer' or 'customer,' it doesn't perfectly capture the technical meaning of 'Client' in an OAuth context. 'Client' refers to an application accessing resources on behalf of a user. A more appropriate translation would convey the 'application' or 'software' aspect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "අයදුම්පත" (ayadumapata - application) or "සඟය යෙදුම" (sagaya yeduma - companion application) depending on the specific context.  A more literal, though potentially less understandable, option could be "පහන යෙදුම" (pahana yeduma - accessing application).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Khách" can mean "guest" or "customer," it's not the most accurate translation for "Client" in the context of OAuth. "Client" refers to an application accessing resources on behalf of a user. A more suitable translation would be something like "ứng dụng" (application) or "khách hàng" (customer), depending on the specific nuance required.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "ứng dụng" (application) or "khách hàng" (customer) instead of "Khách".
